entry.title: Yeah! Finally... The Internet Explorer 6 Countdown Moving the world off Internet Explorer 6
entry.content:
“10 years ago a browser was born. Its name was Internet Explorer 6. Now that we’re in 2011, in an era of modern web standards, it’s time to say goodbye.” (Source: ie6countdown.com)

Do your part to get IE6 to 0%:

  1. JOIN THE CAUSE
  2. EDUCATE OTHERS

entry.title: Wise Words abouy Life by Steve Jobs
entry.content:
Wise Words by Steve Jobs:

”[…] Life can be much broader, once you discover one simple fact, and that is that everything around you that you call life was made up by people that were no smarter than you. And you can change it, you can influence it, you can build your own things that other people can use. Once you learn that, you’ll never be the same again.”

(Via swissmiss.)

entry.title: Wordle.net - word cloud from del.icio.us tags
entry.content:
The word cloud below is created using the tags of my del.icio.us bookmarks. I really like this type of visual representation of the things I dig :-).

“Wordle is a toy for generating “word clouds” from text that you provide. The clouds give greater prominence to words that appear more frequently in the source text. You can tweak your clouds with different fonts, layouts, and color schemes. The images you create with Wordle are yours to use however you like. You can print them out, or save them to the Wordle gallery to share with your friends.” (Source: wordle.net)

According to the service’s Terms of use you’re entitled to use your Wordle in any way you choose - so GO, create your own Wordle by either…

  • …pasting in a bunch of text.
  • …providing the URL of any blog, blog feed, or any other web page that has an Atom or RSS feed.
  • … or - like me - entering a del.icio.us user name to see the tags.

entry.title: Links for April 16th through May 23rd (del.icio.us)
entry.content:
These are semanticdreamer’s del.icio.us bookmarks for April 16th through May 23rd:

  • wysihtml5 - a rich text editor based on HTML5 technology and the progressive-enhancement approach.
  • Tails - is a live DVD or live USB that aims at preserving your privacy and anonymity.
  • Mocha - the fun, simple, flexible JavaScript test framework - is a feature-rich JavaScript test framework running on node and the browser, making asynchronous testing simple and fun. Mocha tests run serially, allowing for flexible and accurate reporting, while mapping uncaught exceptions to the correct test cases.
  • Fountain | A markup language for screenwriting. - is a plain text markup language for screenwriting.
  • Underscore.string - s string manipulation extension for JavaScript that you can use with or without
  • flotr2 - a library for drawing HTML5 charts and graphs
  • OnePAD - is the “one-page-a-day” notebook that works on your iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch and syncs using your iCloud account. There are no “files” or “folders”, just one page for every day of the year.
  • Brunch - a lightweight approach to building HTML5 applications with emphasis on elegance and simplicity
  • volojs/volo - a JavaScript dependency manager and project creation tool that favors GitHub for the package repository. Written in JavaScript for JavaScript.
  • volojs/create-responsive-template - sets up a repsonsive webapp that uses Twitter Bootstrap along with AppCache and network events.
  • Postgres.app - the easiest way to run PostgreSQL on the Mac
  • fixie.js - is an open source tool that automatically adds filler content to HTML documents.
  • RubyMotion - Ruby for iOS - is a toolchain for iOS. It lets you quickly develop and test native iOS applications for iPhone or iPad, all using the awesome Ruby language you know and love.
  • Koottam Social jQuery Plugin | Customized Facebook, Twitter, Google Buttons Using Cross Browser CSS3 - a simple, powerful and elegant Social jQuery Plugin to display your social links. The plugin can be highly customized through 10+ options.
  • The Miso Project :: Dataset - s a JavaScript client-side data transformation and management library. Dataset makes managing client-side data easy by handling loading, parsing, sorting, querying & manipulating data from all sorts of sources.
  • formd - is a tool for (for)matting (m)ark(d)own that allows rapid conversion between the two styles of Markdown links—inline and referenced.
  • The OpenPhoto Project - a photo application that lets you store your photos on Dropbox, Amazon S3 or in your garage.
  • Sisyphus.js - Gmail-like saving of client-side drafts
  • locache.js - is a simple framework to help you cache objects on the client-side.
  • jQuery File Upload Demo - File Upload widget with multiple file selection, drag&drop; support, progress bars and preview images for jQuery.
  • Meteor -
  • Tiny! Issue -
  • Legit (Git Workflow for Humans) - is a complementary command-line interface for Git, optimized for workflow simplicity. It is heavily inspired by GitHub for Mac.
  • OSX For Hackers -
  • Clutch.io - is a specialized web view. It can be placed anywhere in an app where you want to show dynamic, updatable, native-acting content. Clutch pre-downloads all of the CSS, JavaScript, and HTML needed to render a page–locally to the phone–so your page renders instantly.
  • Timeline - Beautifully crafted timelines that are easy, and intuitive to use.
  • foresight.js - gives webpages the ability to tell if the user's device is capable of viewing high-resolution images
  • StyleDocco - generates documentation and style guide documents from your stylesheets.
  • Open Advice - s a knowledge collection from a wide variety of Free Software projects. It answers the question what 42 prominent contributors would have liked to know when they started so you can get a head-start no matter how and where you contribute.
  • 1Keyboard - is a virtual bluetooth keyboard application for Mac OS Lion. With 1Keyboard, you can wirelessly connect to all your bluetooth enabled devices, and use your Mac’s keyboard to type on all of them.
  • Reflection.app - AirPlay mirror your iPhone 4S or iPad 2 to any Mac running OS X 10.6+, wirelessly.
  • indexr - small footprint fancy directory lister with thumbnails
  • CurlFtpFS - is a filesystem for accessing FTP hosts based on FUSE and libcurl.
  • sql.js - is a port of SQLite to JavaScript, by compiling the SQLite C code with Emscripten.
  • Backstretch - a simple jQuery plugin that allows you to add a dynamically-resized background image to any page
  • PuppetCookbook.com - A collection of task oriented solutions in Puppet
  • Zend Framework Boilerplate - is a code blueprint for enterprise-grade PHP applications and a virtual development environment. It combines the most popular code libraries such as Zend Framework, Doctrine 2 and Symfony Components and ships with all the glue code to make the libraries work together seamlessly. ZF-Boilerplate also is a virtual development environment.
  • TodoMVC - A common learning application for popular JavaScript MV* frameworks
  • Interpreted Languages side-by-side reference sheet - Interpreted Languages: PHP, Perl, Python, Ruby (Sheet One) a side-by-side reference sheet
  • is.gd - is an ethical URL shortener
  • Mobile Tuxedo - Mobile Application Development Resources
  • JavaScript Page Scroller - jQuery Smooth Scrolling Plugin
  • Supersized - is a fullscreen background slideshow built using the jQuery library.
  • MultiCD - multicd.sh is a shell script designed to build a multiboot CD image containing many different Linux distributions and/or utilities.
  • Stasis - Stasis takes a directory tree with supported template files and renders them.
  • Hogan.js - is a 2.5k JS templating engine developed at Twitter.
  • js1k.com - A lovely js competition - The object of this competition is to create a cool JavaScript "application" no larger than 1k.
  • stormfs - mount amazon s3 as a local filesystem
  • Enyo JavaScript Application Framework - is an open source object-oriented JavaScript framework emphasizing encapsulation and modularity.
  • impress.js - a presentation framework based on the power of CSS3 transforms and transitions in modern browsers.
  • bitpocket - DIY Dropbox" or "2-way directory (r)sync with proper deletion
  • Chive - is a free, open source, web-based MySQL database administration/ management tool - aims to be an alternative to phpMyAdmin.
  • Octopress - is a blogging framework for hackers designed by Brandon Mathis for Jekyll, the blog aware static site generator powering Github Pages.
  • Jekyll-Bootstrap - Provides detailed explanations, examples, and helper-code to make getting started with Jekyll easier.
  • phoshare - Exports and synchronizes images and metadata from iPhoto on a Mac
  • AJA System Test -
  • Kod - is a programmers' editor for OS X
  • nowjs for Node - Directly call remote functions in Javascript - NowJS creates a magic namespace "now", accessible by server and client, Functions and variables added to now are automatically synced, in real-time, Call client functions from the server and server functions from client
  • BrowserCouch - is an attempt at an in-browser MapReduce implementation. It's written entirely in JavaScript and intended to work on all browsers.
  • AppFog - is a cloud-(Cloud Foundry) based hosting service.
  • PouchDB - Portable CouchDB JavaScript implementation. It's a complete implementation of the CouchDB storage and views API that supports peer-to-peer replication with other CouchDB instances. The browser version is written for IndexedDatabase (part of HTML5). An additional implementation is in progress for leveldb.
  • batman.js - is a framework for building rich web applications with CoffeeScript or JavaScript. App code is concise and declarative, thanks to a powerful system of view bindings and observable properties. The API is designed with developer and designer happiness as its first priority.
  • Hakyll - is a Haskell library for generating static sites, mostly aimed at small-to-medium sites and personal blogs. It is written in a very configurable way and uses an xmonad-like DSL for configuration.
  • Task.js: Beautiful Concurrency for JavaScript - is an experimental library for ES6 that makes sequential, blocking I/O simple and beautiful, using the power of JavaScript’s new yield operator. Tasks are interleaved like threads, but they are cooperative rather than pre-emptive: they block on promises with yield.
  • Intel® NAS Performance Toolkit - Provides user-relevant performance measurements across variety of storage devices.
  • NAS Charts - File Copy Write Performance
  • Geppetto - an integrated toolset for developing puppet modules and manifests
  • Pow: Zero-configuration Rack server for Mac OS X - is a zero-config Rack server for Mac OS X.
  • couchapp/couchdb-login-jquery - the least code way to add login to a CouchApp,
  • Ember.js - is a JavaScript framework for creating ambitious web applications
  • emailcharter.org - Save Our Inboxes! Adopt the Email Charter! - The Email Charter was created in response to widespread acknowledgement that email is getting out of hand for many people.
  • inuit.css—cooler than a polar bear’s toenails… -
  • Amazium - a responsive web framework.
  • Skeleton - is a small collection of CSS & JS files that can help you rapidly develop sites that look beautiful at any size, be it a 17" laptop screen or an iPhone.
  • Cube - is an open-source system for visualizing time series data, built on MongoDB, Node and D3. If you send Cube timestamped events (with optional structured data), you can easily build realtime visualizations of aggregate metrics for internal dashboards.
  • Bonsai - builds dynamic web sites that run anywhere. Perfect for portfolios, catalogues and other image-heavy sites.
  • Humans TXT: We Are People, Not Machines. - t's an initiative for knowing the people behind a website. It's a TXT file that contains information about the different people who have contributed to building the website.
  • iOS Boilerplate - A base template for iOS apps
  • Foundation - rock-solid, responsive framework for rapidly prototyping
  • Popcorn.js, Mozilla Popcorn - is an event system for HTML5 media developers. Think jQuery for video.
  • Coordino - a FREE PHP StackOverflow Clone
  • ScraperWiki - a community of programmers sifting information to give you the edge. Refine, reuse and request data.
  • Handlebars.js: Minimal Templating on Steroids - provides the power necessary to let you build semantic templates effectively with no frustration.
  • flatironjs.org - an unobtrusive framework initiative for node.js
  • Raphaël—JavaScript Library - is a small JavaScript library that should simplify your work with vector graphics on the web.
  • Occupy Flash - The movement to rid the world of the Flash Player plugin
  • Wordle - is a toy for generating “word clouds” from text that you provide.
  • Spine - Build Awesome JavaScript MVC Applications
  • Drinkify - automatically generates the perfect* cocktail recipe to accompany any music…
  • CopyPasteCharacter.com - A web and iPhone application for copying the ‘hidden’ characters that comes with the computer’s typefaces, to be pasted into emails, tweets, text documents, forums…
  • Mobile UI Patterns - features collections of mobile interfaces. Fantastic (growing) resource for UI designers.
  • Travis CI - a distributed build system for the open source community.
  • schacon/showoff - is a Sinatra web app that reads simple configuration files for a presentation. It is sort of like a Keynote web app engine - think S5 + Slidedown.
  • couchapp-cucumber - Cucumber drop-in for testing couchapps
  • cocoa-rest-client - Mac OS X app for testing HTTP/Restful endpoints.
  • Amazon Product - is a Nokogiri-backed Ruby wrapper to the Amazon Product Advertising API.
  • IE App Compat VHD - Internet Explorer Application Compatibility VPC Image
  • All in - Designing for everyone, everywhere.
  • Stacey - is a lightweight content management system. No database setup or installation files, simply drop the application on a server and it runs. Your content is managed by creating folders and editing text files. No login screens, no admin interface.
  • Ender - the no-library library. - is a full featured package manager for your browser.

These are semanticdreamer’s del.icio.us bookmarks for April 16th from 20:34 to 20:34:

  • Let me google that for you -

entry.title: Recipe: How-to install Pandoc on OS X 10.6.x (Snow Leopard)
entry.content:
In case you wonder how-to install Pandoc, the ”universal document converter” on OS X Snow Leopard…

… the secret sauce: go for Haskell Platform installer instead of following your standard (assumption!) installation approach using MacPorts.

The steps:

  1. First install Haskell Platform.
  2. cabal update
  3. cabal install cabal-install
  4. cabal install pandoc
  5. Update your ~/.profile file with export PATH=/Users/[USERNAME]/.cabal/bin:$PATH and read in with source ~/.profile.

What is Pandoc? Great you asked! ;)

Pandoc can read markdown and (subsets of) reStructuredText, HTML, and LaTeX, and it can write plain text, markdown, reStructuredText, HTML, LaTeX, ConTeXt, PDF, RTF, DocBook XML, OpenDocument XML, ODT, GNU Texinfo, MediaWiki markup, groff man pages, and S5 HTML slide shows. PDF output (via LaTeX) is also supported with the included markdown2pdf wrapper script.
– Source and more details: johnmacfarlane.net/pandoc

entry.title: Links for April 5th (del.icio.us)
entry.content:
These are semanticdreamer’s del.icio.us bookmarks for April 5th from 16:03 to 18:17:

  • wmd - The Wysiwym Markdown Editor - is a simple, lightweight Wysiwym (What You See Is What You Mean) HTML editor for blog comments, forum posts, and basic content management.
  • Webby - Ruby-based static website management system, aka. generator.
  • html2markdown - Python script to convert HTML back into Markdown.

entry.title: Recipe: How-to install CouchDB 0.11.0 from source on OS X
entry.content:
Prerequisite: MacPorts installed and SVN client at hand - I prefer a UI and therefore use Versions.

  • sudo port install autoconf automake libtool
  • sudo port install icu erlang spidermonkey curl
  • svn co http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/couchdb/tags/0.11.0 couchdb-0.11.0-src
  • cd couchdb-0.11.0-src
  • ./bootstrap
  • ./configure
    >> You have configured Apache CouchDB, time to relax.
  • make && sudo make install
    >> You have installed Apache CouchDB, time to relax.
  • Start the CouchDB server by running: sudo -i couchdb -b
    >> Apache CouchDB has started, time to relax.
  • To check that everything has worked, point your web browser to: http://127.0.0.1:5984/_utils/index.html

Usefull resources:

  • CouchDB: The Definitive Guide - Part VI. Appendix Installing from Source
  • Apache Couch DB Source Code

entry.title: CouchDB, finally relaxing!!
entry.content:
The other day(s) I found myself relaxing while coding away a pet project (a tiny schemaless personal project, activity and knowledge management web application) leveraging CouchDB and jQuery.

“CouchDB is a document-oriented database that can be queried and indexed in a MapReduce fashion using JavaScript […] provides a RESTful JSON API than can be accessed from any environment that allows HTTP requests […] is written in Erlang […]” (Source: couchdb.apache.org)

Check out CouchApp in order to write CouchDB applications by using just JavaScript and HTML.

“CouchApp is designed to structure standalone CouchDB application development for maximum application portability. CouchApp is a set of scripts and a jQuery plugin designed to bring clarity and order to the freedom of CouchDB’s document-based approach.” (Source: CouchApp)
